author: Joseph De Avila
title: Connecticut Supreme Court Nominee Is Blocked by State Republicans
text:
Republicans in the Connecticut Senate on Tuesday blocked the confirmation of Gov. Dannel Malloyâ€™s choice for chief justice of the state Supreme Court in a highly unusual partisan dispute over a judicial nomination.
The state Senate voted against elevating Associate Justice Andrew McDonald, who has served on the Supreme Court since 2013, to the top spot on the court by a vote of 19 to 16. The state Senate is equally divided between Republicans and Democrats, but one Democratic senator recused herself due to a conflict.
